Class Person

java.lang.Object
Person
public class Person extends Object
Class that represents the things in the game that can move and collect items.

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      public Person(GameMap gameMap)
      Constructor for Person class.
      Parameters:
      gameMap - Map is passed to allow access to its functions.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move(String direction) throws IllegalArgumentException, Error
      Moves the person in one of 4 cardinal directions. Prevents person from walking through walls and off the array
      Parameters:
      direction - Direction that the person moves in. "N", "S", "E", and "W" are the only accepted values for the string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when a string has anything other than "N", "S", "E", or "W".
      Error - Thrown when attempting to enter a wall.

    • quitGame

      public boolean quitGame()
      Performs checks to see if person can quit game with a win message or not
      Returns:
      Bool for game quit outcome. Depends on whether person is on exit tile and has enough gold.

    • pickUpGold

      public boolean pickUpGold()
      Picks up gold providing that valid tile is at the persons coordinates. If tile is valid, then it is "consumed" and becomes a standard tile. Moreover, the gold is incremented by 1.
      Returns:
      Returns true if gold was successfully picked up

    • getCoordinates

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getCoordinates()
      Gets the coordinates of the person.
      Returns:
      Hashmap of the coordinates. Hashmap has key values "x" and "y".

    • getNumGold

      public int getNumGold()
      Returns the amount of gold the person has collected.
      Returns:
      Integer contain the amount of gold the person has collected.
